Status Effects

Status effects in Remixed Dungeon are temporary conditions that modify character abilities, attributes, or game mechanics. They can be beneficial (buffs) or harmful (debuffs).

Beneficial Effects (Buffs)

  • Regeneration - Gradually heals HP
  • Haste - Increases movement and attack speed
  • Invisibility - Makes you undetectable to enemies
  • Levitation - Allows movement over traps and special terrain
  • Shield - Provides temporary damage absorption
  • Strength Boost - Temporary increase in strength
  • Heroism - Enhances all combat abilities
  • Barkskin - Reduces physical damage taken
  • Blessed - Increases accuracy and evasion
  • Candle of Mind Vision - Reveals nearby dungeon layout
  • Awareness - Reveals all creatures on the level
  • Light - Provides light in dark areas
  • Mind Vision - See all creatures on the level
  • Mana Regeneration - Restores mana over time
  • Shadows - Hides you in darkness, reducing detection
  • Speed - Increases movement speed
  • Sniper's Mark - Increases accuracy against marked target
  • Combo - Increases damage based on consecutive attacks
  • Fury - Increases damage but prevents healing
  • Item Action - Allows quick item usage

Harmful Effects (Debuffs)

  • Poison - Gradually damages HP
  • Burning - Damages while on fire
  • Bleeding - Damages over time
  • Paralysis - Prevents all actions
  • Weakness - Reduces strength and damage
  • Slow - Reduces movement and attack speed
  • Blindness - Reduces accuracy and prevents identification
  • Charm - Makes enemies fight for you temporarily
  • Roots - Prevents movement
  • Ooze - Deals continuous damage until cleaned
  • Stun - Temporarily disables actions
  • Terror - Forces character to flee in fear
  • Vertigo - Causes disorientation, random movement
  • Frost - Causes cold damage and prevents action
  • Sleep - Puts character to sleep
  • Amok - Forces character to attack randomly
  • Cripple - Reduces movement speed by 50%

Duration and Mechanics

  • Most status effects have a timed duration that counts down each turn
  • Some effects stack, others overwrite previous instances of the same type
  • Powerful effects may override lesser effects of the same type
  • Duration can be affected by certain class abilities or equipment
  • Some effects have special removal methods (e.g., water removes Ooze)

Remedies and Prevention

  • Potion of Healing can cure poison, bleeding, blindness, and paralysis
  • Scroll of Remove Curse can cure cursed status
  • Potion of Might can remove debuffs
  • Potion of Frost can extinguish burning
  • Stepping into water removes burning and ooze effects
  • Some class abilities provide resistance to specific effects
  • Certain equipment provides protection against common status effects

Strategic Use

  • Apply beneficial effects before challenging encounters
  • Remove harmful effects with appropriate items or abilities
  • Some enemies are particularly vulnerable to specific status effects
  • Certain equipment synergizes well with specific status effects
  • Timing is critical for maximum effect from buffs
  • Debuffs can turn the tide of difficult battles

Class Interactions

  • Mages can apply various elemental status effects
  • Rogues have abilities to grant stealth or apply debuffs
  • Priests can provide healing and protective buffs
  • Necromancers can apply and exploit various debuffs
  • Warriors can use certain buffs to enhance combat effectiveness
  • Huntresses have abilities that interact with several status effects

See Also

  • Game Mechanics - Other core game systems
  • Potions - Items that often provide status effects
  • Scrolls - Items that can apply status effects
